content: 3 single_crochet worked through 4 loops two loops from the body two loops from the wings single_crochet 4 over the next three stitches we sew in the wings hold the wings in the correct spot with the right side facing the body and the wrong side facing out using a loose single_crochet pick up both loops of the wings and then both loops of the body finish the single_crochet like normal do the same for the next two stitches that is one wing joined single_crochet 11 repeat joining the other wing over the next 3 single_crochet single_crochet 4 summary - single_crochet 4 single_crochet 3 for wing single_crochet 11 single_crochet 3 for wing single_crochet 4 = 25 stitches beak now the wings are on you can see the middle of the work with either 2 or 3 single_crochet between them your preference thread the two ends of the beak through the body/face and simply tie the ends securely together at the back of the head i like to work in either row 7 or 8 but again this is your preference for placement eyes put your safety eyes in now row 11-13 single_crochet 25 25 stitches row 14 *decrease in next single_crochet single_crochet 3* repeat around 20 stitches row 15 working in the back loops of row 14 complete - *decrease single_crochet 2* repeat around 15 stitches feet join the feet to the body i place mine in line with the outer edge of the beak you can either knot each leg to the inside individually or just tie the two strands together they will slide with this method but it is easy to adjust i like to pull one or two chain through the back as well it makes it easier to twist the legs later so that they sit the right way stuff start stuffing and shaping the body the stuffing should be solid in the head and upper belly but light stuffing at the bottom this will help the bird sit flat row 16 *decrease in next single_crochet single_crochet 1* repeat around 10 stitches bind bind off and leave a large tail using your needle thread around the outside of the remaining 10 stitches and pull closed tie off and thread the tail back up through the body criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/easy-chick-crow-bird criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/easy-chick-crow-bird criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/easy-chick-crow-bird
